newsitem.title: FINLAND: Neste CEO says trading loss may fall.
newsitem.headline: Neste CEO says trading loss may fall.

text.p: Neste CEO Jaakko Ihamuotila said on Friday 495 million markka was the ceiling for its January-August write-down on crude oil derivatives trades, and the loss could even shrink if crude oil prices kept rising.

"The loss is limited to this 495 million markka, but if the oil price trend is favourable to us, the loss may be smaller," Ihamuotila told a news conference after Neste reported a surprise 26 million markka January-August loss.
He said Neste's trading position now was such that rising crude oil prices would benefit it, because its open positions were smaller than the volume of its own crude production. @
"If crude oil prices later rise ... our own crude oil production is substantially larger than these trading volumes, so we would benefit more from a rise ... than we would suffer," said Ihamuotila.
The 495 million markka write-down includes about 300 million markka in losses actually booked during the January-August reporting period, Ihamuotila said.
Neste said the write-down covered its estimate of losses at current prices through to end-August 1997.
